intro: Pouchetia saxifraga, commonly known as the stonecrop pouchetia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family, characterized by its upright growth habit and clustered, small flowers. The plant typically features succulent leaves that are adapted to arid environments, allowing it to store water efficiently. Its flowers are usually pink or red, and they bloom in late spring or early summer. Pouchetia saxifraga thrives in rocky soils and is often found in high-altitude habitats.
